HomePage.vehicle_title: The Sustainable Campus Management Center (SCMC) is the primary unit driving the university towards becoming a smart and sustainable city. It integrates technology and innovation in physical infrastructure, environment, energy, transportation, and safety. The Center manages fundamental utilities such as electricity, water supply, and wastewater treatment, as well as promotes the use of clean energy and develops smart transportation systems within the university to sustainably enhance the quality of life for students, staff, and the surrounding community.

AboutPage.about_title: The Sustainable Campus Management Center – SCMC, Chiang Mai University, is the core unit driving Chiang Mai University towards becoming a Smart & Sustainable City. It integrates technology, innovation, and data for efficient resource management, covering environment, energy, transportation, safety, and infrastructure within the university. The Center manages fundamental utilities like electricity, water, wastewater, and buildings, while promoting clean energy, energy conservation, and green technology. It develops and manages smart public transport systems such as the CMU Transit, supports green spaces, systematic waste management, and carbon footprint reduction. Monitoring and evaluation are conducted via real-time Dashboard and Smart Sensor systems for transparency and accountability at all management levels. It fosters participation from students, personnel, and partners in developing sustainable approaches, creating a model “Eco-University” that is environmentally and community-friendly. It serves as a policy experimentation area for sustainability, aiming for city and national-level expansion under the systematic and balanced concept of “Smart – Sustainable – Safe,” ensuring a good quality of life for everyone within the university and surrounding community.
AboutPage.vision_title: To be a leading university campus management center, driven by smart technology for environmental sustainability, energy, transportation, and the balanced quality of life for everyone within the university.

mission_points.1: Efficient and sustainable management of infrastructure and resources.
mission_points.2: Development of information technology systems for smart city management.
mission_points.3: Promotion of clean energy, resource conservation, and waste reduction.
mission_points.4: Support for smart transportation systems and safe access to areas.
mission_points.5: Fostering community participation in sustainable university city development.
